OneCite - Universal Citation & Academic Reference ToolkitÔÉÅ

OneCite is a powerful command-line tool and Python library designed to automate the tedious process of citation management. Feed it anything‚ÄîDOIs, paper titles, arXiv IDs, or even a mix‚Äîand get clean, accurate bibliographic entries in return.

Key FeaturesÔÉÅ

  • üîç Smart Recognition - Fuzzy matching against multiple academic databases

  • üìö Universal Formats - Support for BibTeX, APA, and MLA output formats

  • üéØ High-Accuracy Pipeline - 4-stage process ensures highest quality output

  • ü§ñ Auto-Completion - Automatically enriches entries with missing metadata

  • üéì 7+ Citation Types - Handles journal articles, conference papers, books, software, datasets, theses, and preprints

  • üìÑ Universal Identifiers - Accepts DOI, PMID, arXiv ID, ISBN, GitHub URLs, Zenodo DOI, or plain text queries

  • ü§ñ AI Assistant Integration - Full Model Context Protocol (MCP) support

Data SourcesÔÉÅ

OneCite integrates with multiple authoritative academic data sources:

  • CrossRef - Academic publication metadata

  • Semantic Scholar - AI-powered literature search

  • OpenAlex - Open academic graph

  • PubMed - Biomedical literature

  • DBLP - Computer science bibliography

  • arXiv - Preprint repository

  • DataCite - Scientific datasets

  • Zenodo - Open research data

  • Google Books - Book metadata

Quick StartÔÉÅ

Installation:

pip install onecite

Create a references.txt file:

10.1038/nature14539

Attention is all you need, Vaswani et al., NIPS 2017

Goodfellow, I., Bengio, Y., & Courville, A. (2016). Deep Learning. MIT Press.

Run OneCite:

onecite process references.txt -o results.bib --quiet

For more information, see Quick Start Guide.
